page.title: 13WOODROFFE SCHOOL LYME REGIS
page.content: The Woodroffe School started in the 1920's and it was held in the Woodmead Halls. It was founded by Alban Woodroffe. In the 60's it became a grammar school then became comprehensive. Two more Headmasters were in charge, Mr Greenwood and Mr Pearn and now in the 80's Mr Butterworth is in charge, but he will soon be leaving and at the start of the Autumn term 1985 Mr Vittle will be taking charge. Now we have a big school there are four craft rooms and also maths, french, and science rooms. There are also tennis courts and a top field for games.
